content: [hakon] "That's enough! Both of you are bickering like children instead of leaders!"
[hakon] "The Sundr was real. The varl lives lost at Grofheim and Einartoft can vouch for him."
/=He glares at Hakon.=/
/=All parties look angry and tense...and then they look at you.=/

content.option: "My banner, my people, are my only concern."
"Rugga's right: too many will die out here for so few inside.

content: [$hero] "And my victories have continued with every clansman's life I've saved on our way here."
[$hero] "And when you two wear each other down, who's left if the dredge attack?"
[$hero] "Bellower /=is =/real and my victories have continued with every clansman's life I've saved on our way here."
[$hero] "But Hakon and the other varl--"
[$hero] "I doubt either of you will be in charge of anything when that Darkness washes over us!"
[$hero] "I'm the clan leader of Skogr and I've fought to save every one of my clansmen."
[$hero] "I realize you're upset about Lud--"
[$hero] "No, but I lost my father at the Battle of Boersgard. I'm sorry about Ludin."
[$hero] "No, but I've lost a daughter. Recently. I'm sorry about Ludin."
[$hero] "No, some didn't like it. But some people didn't like my dad either."
[$hero] "/=That =/is why they follow me."
[$hero] "The difference between me showing you respect or not. Please don't try to make me feel small by calling me /=girl =/or /=child."=/
[$hero] "Then allow this good man to bring his clan inside your walls."
[king] "Again, how have /=you=/ come to speak for them? Did you fool them like the people of that rotten town you governed?"
[king] "All of them?"
[king] "And even if they fail, I'll still be able to watch this bastard fall to that Darkness from my walls."
[king] "And what difference does that make?"
[king] "And why shouldn't I have you faen killed right now?"
[king] "A place inside the walls this faen man and those varl will never be allowed again!"
[king] "A place inside the walls alongside the varl. A place this faen man will never be allowed again!"
[king] "Apologies won't bring him back. I loved that boy. Damn it!"
[king] "But even if Bellower was real and you were the one to defeat him, what does one victory actually amount to?"
[king] "But my son's safety lay with these varl and now...now he's gone."
[king] "But you are a--"
[king] "Good. I'm granting you and your people - even those horseborn - entrance into my walls, but move quickly."
[king] "Ha! Humility and confidence all in the same breath."
[king] "He doesn't have to! I'll find a place for the people under your banner, Rook."
[king $hero] "Tell me, girl, why are you leading an entire caravan of humans and horseborn? Why didn't one of the men take point?"

content.option: "The clans trusted my father and learned to trust me."
"Tell me why I shouldn't join these clans in fighting you."

content: [king] "I can see the resolve in your eyes. You've seen things beyond your years."
[king] "I'd hoped you died in Boersgard. How is it you've come to speak for all of these clans?"
[king] "I don't care! Did Jorundr's kendr die while traveling with human protection? No!"
[king] "I earned my throne by strength, Rugga. I can demonstrate on you how I'd handle dredge."
[king] "If I opened the gates to everyone out here, the capital would tear itself apart from the inside."
[king] "I see that. Horseborn included. But what good is that when you've led them here?"
[king] "I've got the Valka and menders seeing to that inside. They'll come up with something."
/=King Meinolf slumps a bit.=/
/=King Meinolf watches you for a moment before chuckling.=/
[king] "None of you seem to understand that Arberrang can only hold so many, can only feed so many."
[king] "She doesn't have to! I'll find a place for the people under your banner, Alette."
[king] "So I heard. Though some might say it was your father who did all the work there too."
[king] "Tell me, girl, why are you leading an entire caravan of humans and horseborn? Why didn't one of the men take point?"
[king] "That's a valuable lesson learned - the sooner you realize you can't please everyone, the sooner you can get to doing something worthwhile."
[king] "That's right. I /=have =/heard about this, but Ludin made it seem like your daughter actually did the work there."
/=The king fixes you with a stare and you realize you are holding your breath.=/
[king] "There are other good men among these clans. It doesn't change how many Arberrang can hold or feed."
[king] "There's nothing good in any of this, but I'll take a small amount of comfort in your death."
[king] "There was a time I'd have gladly invited varl into my great hall, day or night, but not now."
[king] "Unfortunately, it doesn't change how many Arberrang can support."
[king] "Well said. The results of daily tasks are more than any outcome on the battlefield."
[king] "With that many, you might get through a wall or two, but you'll die at the foot of the Black Wall."
[king] "You have no idea what I'm feeling. Have you ever lost a son?"
[king] "You're already dead to me, giant. You and the paltry few of your kind that are left."
[king] "You remind me of the village chieftain from my childhood - a good man."
[king] "/=You =/will never enter my gates again."
/=All parties look angry and tense...and then they look at you.=/
/=Hakon growls and flexes his grip on his axe.=/
[rugga] "Alette, look at your people out there - /=our =/people."
[rugga] "And what? Fail to kill me again?"
[rugga] "And you, giant. Joining this king after all we did to keep your people alive. Traitor!"
[rugga] "Did the Sundr-Slayer convince you to open your gates to your people?"
[rugga] "Don't make us breach your walls. We'll just have to repair them once we're inside."
[rugga $hero] "Don't make us breach your walls. We'll just have to repair them once we're inside."

content.option: Remind them of the rumors of dredge

content: [rugga] "I thought I taught you better, Alette. This isn't how you play the game."
[rugga] "Listen to the pride in this king's voice when he speaks of killing thousands of his people."
[rugga] "Meinolf doesn't know the first thing about fighting dredge. He's been insulated too long."
[rugga] "Rook, look at your people out there - /=our=/ people."
[rugga] "The only fool here is the outnumbered king believing he still has a say in what happens now."
[rugga] "The people you've turned your back on? Seems they needed a leader they could trust."
[rugga] "There's the true heart of the Meinolf I know."
[rugga] "They need food and clean water - not that poison in the river. They need protection."
[rugga] "You cannot allow this /=king =/to keep us from safety after all this way!"
[rugga] "You're a petty king, and no longer deserve the title."
[rugga] "You see, Meinolf? He knows how the game works. Now..."
[rugga] "You see, Meinolf? She knows how the game works. Now..."
[rugga] "You still don't know how to play the game, Rook."
{skip} mark1=$hero mark2=hakon mark3=rugga mark4=king
/=The former governor's eyes look full of mischief.=/
/=The king stares at you and finally nods.=/
/=You look at Hakon for support, but he remains quiet.=/
/=You say nothing.=/
/=You say nothing.=/
/=You try to make eye-contact with Hakon, but he's looking at the ground in shame.=/
